resources.string: Tagger is an easy-to-use app to edit and convert the metadata of mp3-files. It can edit 2 different versions of tags, id3v2.3 and id3v2.4. Those are distinguished by how many tags can be set per field.\n Whilst the newer version supports multiple tags, most systems are designed to work with id3v2.3 tags and cannot display multiple information.

When starting one of the editors you will be presented with a queue in which the soon to be edited files will be listed. You can add complete folders or simply files. After setting up this queue you can start editing.

The Editor has a simple layout. On the top is a header containing information about the Cover and Title you are currently working on as well as buttons to play the current song, share the edited file and to manually save.
 The save button however is not needed all the time as the app automatically saves whenever another file in queue is edited. 
 By clicking on the artwork on the header a new selection pops up and there are different options available: 
 • Camera 
 • Gallery 
 • Generator
This function gives you the option to define a pattern using xml and generates covers from the information stored in the tags of a given mp3-file.

This option in the menu is used to betetr organize your mp3-files on your phone by giving them names according to their tags. This can be applied to all mp3-files on your phone or to a selection of files. The pattern which the files get renamed after is defined in the settings with following possible attributes: 
 • %artist% - Artist
 • %track% - Track number
 • %album% - Album name
 • %genre% - Genre
